section.title: Apache Trafficserver Plugin Configuration
section.para: In order to load IronBee into Apache Trafficserver (ATS) you must edit plugins.config to first load the IronBee library using the ATS loader plugin, then load the IronBee plugin with an IronBee configuration.

para.programlisting:
### plugins.config # Load the IronBee library /usr/local/ironbee/lib/libloader.so /usr/local/ironbee/lib/libironbee.so
# Load the IronBee plugin /usr/local/ironbee/lib/ts_ironbee.so /usr/local/ironbee/etc/ironbee-ts.conf

section.title: TrafficServer Library Loader Plugin
section.para: Description: Load arbitrary shared libraries.
Version: 0.5.0
If TxLogging is enabled, it may also be necessary to load libyajl version 2.x with libloader.

section.title: TrafficServer IronBee Plugin
section.para: Description: Bootstrap the trafficserver ironbee plugin.
Version: 0.8.0

The default log filename is "ts-ironbee.log" and log level 4. The optional -l name sets a different name, while -v n sets a log level, and -L disables logging Ironbee messages by Trafficserver altogether (for users with an alternative logger configured).

section.title: Apache Httpd Module Configuration
section.para:
In order to load IronBee into Apache httpd you must edit the httpd.conf to first load the IronBee module, then configure the module to bootstrap the IronBee library.### httpd.conf
# Load the IronBee module LoadModule ironbee_module /usr/local/ironbee/lib/mod_ironbee.so
# Bootstrap the IronBee library <IfModule ironbee_module> # Specify the IronBee configuration file. IronbeeConfigFile /usr/local/ironbee/etc/ironbee-httpd.conf
# Send raw headers (from client) to Ironbee for inspection # instead of the (potentially modified) httpd headers. IronbeeRawHeaders On </IfModule>
From here, you can configure Apache httpd as either a webserver or a proxy server.

section.title: IronbeeConfigFile
section.para: Description: Location of the main IronBee configuration file.
Version: 0.5.0

section.title: IronbeeRawHeaders
section.para: Description: Use the raw (client) headers or the proxy headers in ironbee.
Version: 0.5.0
Setting this to On will cause IronBee to be sent the raw headers from the client. Setting this to Off will cause IronBee to be sent the proxied headers (those seen by the server).

section.title: IronbeeFilterInput
section.para: Description: Filter HTTP request body data.
Version: 0.8.0
Determines whether HTTP request bodies (where present) are sent to Ironbee for inspection.

section.title: IronbeeFilterOutput
section.para: Description: Filter HTTP response body data.
Version: 0.8.0
Determines whether HTTP response bodies (where present) are sent to Ironbee for inspection.

section.title: IronbeeLog
section.para: Description: Enable/Disable apache logging.
Version: 0.8.0
Determines whether Ironbee messages are logged to the HTTPD error log. If disabled, some other logger should be configured.

section.title: IronbeeLogLevel
section.para: Description: Set default Ironbee log level.
Version: 0.8.0
Sets the initial log level for Ironbee messages (ignored if IronbeeLog is Off).

section.title: Nginx Configuration
section.para: From here, you can configure nginx.

section.title: ironbee_config_file
section.para: Description: Location of the main IronBee configuration file.
Version: 0.7.0
This needs to go in the nginx "http" block.

section.title: ironbee_logger
section.para: Description: Enable the ironbee logger.
Version: 0.7.0
This needs to go in the nginx "http" block.

section.title: ironbee_loglevel
section.para: Description: Set the (numeric) ironbee log level.
Version: 0.7.0
This needs to go in the nginx "http" block.
